page.title: 13Dairying in Dundrennan
page.content: Overlaw and Newlaw are owned by the same family.There are 495 acres on Overlaw and 490 acres on Newlaw. On Newlaw 16.37% is used for the dairy cows,whereas on Overlaw 15.67% is used for the dairy cows. The majority of Newlaw with a massive 60.37% is used for rough grazing,but on Overlaw there is only 9.07% used for rough grazing. There are 114 cows on Newlaw and 116 cows on Overlaw in the dairy herds.The average cow uses 0.5 an acre for grazing and 0.5 an acre for silage. As well as milk ,Newlaw and Overlaw also produce beef and mutton.There are 1353 sheep altogether with 773 sheep on Overlaw and 580 sheep on Newlaw.
